environmental-management-intensive.title: IGCSE Environmental Management (Cambridge 0680)
environmental-management-intensive.shortDescription: Environmental management (EM) remains a strong starting point for learners beginning their journey into GCSE-level education and is an excellent way to round off other studies with a wide range of topics relevant to understanding 21st century challenges. This course is for exams up to May/June or October/November 2026 with the syllabus changing for exams from 2027 onwards!

fullDescription.overview: Environmental management (EM) remains a strong starting point for learners beginning their journey into GCSE-level education and is an excellent way to round off other studies with a wide range of topics relevant to understanding 21st century challenges. This course is for exams up to May/June or October/November 2026 with the syllabus changing for exams from 2027 onwards!
fullDescription.details: Environmental Management (EM) is the study of environmental processes and systems and how to manage the influences of human activity on these systems. We consider the benefits humans get from 'nature', the impacts of humans on their environment and how to manage these impacts more sustainably.
fullDescription.suitability: This syllabus covers a broad range of interesting topics from the natural world that are accessible and relevant to students and is therefore ideal for those starting their secondary-level education, those with an interest in the natural world or the sciences, or those wishing to complement other studies with a better understanding of global systems

geography-intensive.title: IGCSE Geography (Edexcel 4GE1)
geography-intensive.shortDescription: The Edexcel Geography syllabus provides a comprehensive foundation in both physical and human geography, helping students understand the complex relationships between people, places and environments. Perfect for developing analytical skills and global awareness, this course combines theoretical knowledge with practical fieldwork experience. Students gain valuable insights into current global challenges while developing transferable skills in basic data analysis and research.

fullDescription.overview: The Edexcel Geography syllabus provides a comprehensive foundation in both physical and human geography, helping students understand the complex relationships between people, places and environments. Perfect for developing analytical skills and global awareness, this course combines theoretical knowledge with practical fieldwork experience. Students gain valuable insights into current global challenges while developing transferable skills in basic data analysis and research.
fullDescription.details: Geography is the study of the Earth. This involves studying the physical processes that govern life on Earth but also studying human societies and their influence and reliance on Earth systems.
fullDescription.suitability: The Edexcel syllabus helps students on that journey by focusing on five aspects of geography, developing the skills necessary to research, explain and analyse how geographical processes work and draw the conclusions between them.

marine-science-2year.title: IGCSE Marine Science (Cambridge 0697)
marine-science-2year.shortDescription: The Marine Science IGCSE investigates the physical, chemical and biological processes that shape the oceans and their ecosystems. It is an ideal course for those with an interest in the marine environment, ecology and conservation. In this course we also look at human interaction with marine ecosystems, how we depend on them, and how humans may damage marine ecosystems.

fullDescription.overview: The Marine Science IGCSE investigates the physical, chemical and biological processes that shape the oceans and their ecosystems. It is an ideal course for those with an interest in the marine environment, ecology and conservation. In this course we also look at human interaction with marine ecosystems, how we depend on them, and how humans may damage marine ecosystems. This course involves practical investigations into the physical and chemical properties of oceans, examination of biological populations and ecological investigations into the communities found in coastal habitats.

features: Guided preparation for practical and ecological investigations
Groupwork for data analysis and presentation methods

environmental-science-alevel.title: A-level Environmental Science (AQA -7447)

schedule.additionalInfo: First year: September 2025 - July 2026, Second year: September 2026 - May 2027

environmental-science-alevel.shortDescription: The Environmental Science A-level takes an understanding gained of issues studied in Environmental Management and other scientific disciplines related to global processes to a new level of scientific rigour and analysis. It is an ideal stepping stone for those wishing to gain employment in a wide variety of fields include land management, energy and mineral resource management, and ecology and conservation

fullDescription.overview: The Environmental Science (ES) A-level takes an understanding gained of issues studied in Environmental Management and other scientific disciplines related to global processes to a new level of scientific rigour and analysis. It is an ideal stepping stone for those wishing to gain employment in a wide variety of fields include land management, energy and mineral resource management, and ecology and conservation
fullDescription.details: The ES syllabus builds on existing studies in disciplines such as Environmental Management, Geography or Marine Science. Some prior experience in these disciplines and some basic mathematics is expected. This course provides all of the content and assessment necessary to take the exam but as an A-level self-study is an increasingly important part of studied. Classes will deliver content, concept-check understanding and most importantly provide a forum for students to collaborate and share their knowledge. There are some practical requirements to this course and a mandatory fieldtrip with a registered provider is a requirement of many independent exam centres for sitting the exam, and a joint fieldtrip will be organised in collaboration with parents and students during the course
